cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (forecast to become a hurricane Tuesday)
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to enter the southeastern Gulf late Monday, then curl northwest toward the north-west Gulf of Mexico and the Texas–Louisiana border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border (south-west Louisiana coast)

weather_observation.within_uncertainty_cone: No (port lies just southwest of the cone edge)
weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for the western Gulf yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for the western Gulf yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coast from the middle Texas coast eastward across Louisiana and Mississippi likely to experience tropical-storm to hurricane conditions
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) are possible late Wednesday into early Thursday; hurricane-force winds currently appear unlikely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: In advance of the storm, water levels of 3–5 ft above ground level are possible in and near Matagorda Bay, especially if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible Wednesday night–Thursday; localized higher totals if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous surf beginning late Tuesday will likely shut down vessel movements; potential for minor coastal flooding during high tide.
